original:
Dermatologists are trained to identify a wide range of skin diseases based on their appearance, anatomical distribution, and clinical behavior. However, in some instances, these criteria may not yield a definitive diagnosis. In such cases, a skin biopsy may be performed, allowing for microscopic examination using standard histological techniques. 

In certain situations, additional specialized tests may be required on the biopsy samples
sampled: Dermatologists are trained to identify a numerous range of complexion diseases based on their layout, anatomical distribution, plus clinical evidence. However, in a instances, these criteria may not yield a definitive diagnosis. In such cases, a skin remnant may be performed, allowing for microscopic examination using default histological techniques. In certain situations, extra specialized tests may be required on the biopsy samples
